I think it's a combination. I think it's
essentially bankruptcy, bankruptcy with
safeguards that you have credit lines.
We have this most this mechanical thing
which is that uh debtor in possession
financing which you need to just to do
business is not available in the current
market. So an or a chapter 11 if you try
it immediately turns into liquidation
because the credit isn't there. So, you
have to have credit lines from the
federal government just to keep the
thing running. And then on top of that,
you probably need something like
warranties uh for car buyers because
there's the real problem. Will you buy a
car from a company that is uh you know
that that is is bankrupt and may not be
producing those cars? Um, that's
possible and I leave this to the to the
legal minds that it may be necessary to
have a bankruptcy but not in name that
essentially you have a government
seizure but but you don't call it
bankruptcy because the word bankruptcy
itself will scare off the buyers. Uh,
but you know they they cannot be allowed
to simply slide into the in into
whatever it would be. I guess Lake
Michigan uh uh not into the sea but into
the big lake. Um not right now anyway.
Uh but on the other hand, you know,
we're not in the business of letting
management and stockholders off the
hook.
